At algOS, we recognize that addressing the climate crisis requires a diverse array of innovative solutions. With this in mind, we're developing a low-tech, microalgae-based carbon capture and storage technology designed to make a substantial positive impact on our environment, ultimately propelling us towards a carbon-negative future.

Additional

We grow microalgal biomass at scale without interfering with other ecosystems in a closed loop system.

Permanent

Through pyrolysis we produce biochar and (pyrolysis) oil which can be stored for 1.000+ years.

Verifiable

We provide a digital track record of every process step, work with established partners and follow best in class methodologies.

Why Microalgae?

Microalgae are highly efficient at capturing carbon dioxide and have a much faster growth rate than terrestrial plants - after all it's them that created much of our atmosphere how we know it today. Microalgae are grown in an isolated environment ensuring we do not compete for valuable resources that may otherwise be required and to protect existing ecosystems.

Technology

We develop a carbon capturing technology that's sustainable, eco-friendly, and minimizes its impact on existing ecosystems. Our technology captures carbon that would otherwise remain in the atmosphere and stores it permanently. We're committed to creating a solution that's not only effective but also responsible, ensuring a better future for our planet.

Storage

The algae biomass in converted though pyrolysis into a stable carbon product like biochar or bio-oil. This avoids the natural decay of the biomass and the release of the carbon. It enables a long term sequestration of the carbon in the ground.

About us

Our co-founders bring together a diverse and powerful skillset, including expertise in computer science, electronic engineering, control theory, data science, and mathematics. This unique combination of knowledge allows us to innovate and create solutions that address the complex challenges of climate change. At algOS, we are dedicated to making a positive impact on the world, and our team is committed to delivering groundbreaking solutions for a greener future.
Fabio

Fabio has a degree in Computer Science & Biomedical Engineering and loves building things. At algOS he's the jack of all trades master of none.

Remo

With a background in computer science and electrical engineering, Remo works on improving, scaling and parallelizing our reactor designs.

Jan

Jan did his PhD on modelling biological systems and developing numerical methods. At algOS, he develops computational algae models for the optimal carbon uptake from the air.

János

János is a trained mathematician and experienced data scientist & software engineer, he supports algOS in all things data.
